trans-unit.source: An Enumeration can be converted into an Iterator by using the Enumeration.asIterator() method.
An Exchanger allows two threads to exchange objects at a rendezvous point, and is useful in several pipeline designs.
trans-unit.target: Un Exchanger permite que dos subprocesos intercambien objetos en un punto de encuentro y es útil en varios diseños de canalizaciones.

trans-unit.source: An Executor that provides methods to manage termination and methods that can produce a Future for tracking progress of one or more asynchronous tasks.
trans-unit.target: Un Executor que proporciona métodos para administrar la terminación y métodos que pueden producir un Future para rastrear el progreso de una o más tareas asincrónicas.

trans-unit.source: An ExecutorService for running ForkJoinTasks.
trans-unit.target: Un ExecutorService para ejecutar ForkJoinTask s.

trans-unit.source: An ExecutorService for running ForkJoinTasks. A ForkJoinPool provides the entry point for submissions from non-ForkJoinTask clients, as well as management and monitoring operations.
trans-unit.target: Un ExecutorService para ejecutar ForkJoinTask s. Un ForkJoinPool proporciona el punto de entrada para envíos de clientes que no pertenecen a ForkJoinTask , así como también para operaciones de administración y monitoreo.

trans-unit.source: An ExecutorService that can schedule commands to run after a given delay, or to execute periodically.
trans-unit.target: Un ExecutorService que puede programar comandos para que se ejecuten después de un retraso determinado o para que se ejecuten periódicamente.

trans-unit.source: An ExecutorService that executes each submitted task using one of possibly several pooled threads, normally configured using Executors factory methods.
trans-unit.target: Un ExecutorService que ejecuta cada tarea enviada usando uno de posiblemente varios subprocesos agrupados, normalmente configurados usando los métodos de fábrica de Executors .

trans-unit.source: An RMIServer object that is exported through JRMP and that creates client connections as RMI objects exported through JRMP.
trans-unit.target: Un objeto RMIServer que se exporta a través de JRMP y que crea conexiones de cliente como objetos RMI exportados a través de JRMP.

trans-unit.source: An RMIServer object that is exported through JRMP and that creates client connections as RMI objects exported through JRMP. User code does not usually reference this class directly.
trans-unit.target: Un objeto RMIServer que se exporta a través de JRMP y que crea conexiones de cliente como objetos RMI exportados a través de JRMP. El código de usuario no suele hacer referencia a esta clase directamente.

trans-unit.source: An RMIServerImpl that is exported through IIOP and that creates client connections as RMI objects exported through IIOP.
trans-unit.target: Un RMIServerImpl que se exporta a través de IIOP y que crea conexiones de cliente como objetos RMI exportados a través de IIOP.

trans-unit.source: An RMIServerImpl that is exported through IIOP and that creates client connections as RMI objects exported through IIOP. User code does not usually reference this class directly.
trans-unit.target: Un RMIServerImpl que se exporta a través de IIOP y que crea conexiones de cliente como objetos RMI exportados a través de IIOP. El código de usuario no suele hacer referencia a esta clase directamente.

trans-unit.source: An unmodifiable view
trans-unit.target: Una vista inmodificable

trans-unit.source: An APPLICATION_MODAL dialog blocks all top-level windows from the same Java application except those from its own child hierarchy.

An APPLICATION_MODAL dialog blocks all top-level windows from the same Java application except those from its own child hierarchy. If there are several applets launched in a browser, they can be treated either as separate applications or a single one. This behavior is implementation-dependent.
An AWTEvent that adds support for JInternalFrame objects as the event source.

An AWTEvent that adds support for JInternalFrame objects as the event source. This class has the same event types as WindowEvent, although different IDs are used. Help on handling internal frame events is in How to Write an Internal Frame Listener, a section in The Java Tutorial.

An AWTEvent that adds support for JInternalFrame objects as the event source. This class has the same event types as WindowEvent, although different IDs are used. Help on handling internal frame events is in How to Write an Internal Frame Listener, a section in The Java Tutorial.
An AWTKeyStroke represents a key action on the keyboard, or equivalent input device.

An AWTKeyStroke represents a key action on the keyboard, or equivalent input device. AWTKeyStrokes can correspond to only a press or release of a particular key, just as KEY_PRESSED and KEY_RELEASED KeyEvents do; alternately, they can correspond to typing a specific Java character, just as KEY_TYPED KeyEvents do. In all cases, AWTKeyStrokes can specify modifiers (alt, shift, control, meta, altGraph, or a combination thereof) which must be present during the action for an exact match.

An AbstractFormatter can only be active in one JFormattedTextField at a time. JFormattedTextField invokes install when it is ready to use it followed by uninstall when done. Subclasses that wish to install additional state should override install and message super appropriately.

An AccessException is thrown by certain methods of the java.rmi.Naming class (specifically bind, rebind, and unbind) and methods of the java.rmi.activation.ActivationSystem interface to indicate that the caller does not have permission to perform the action requested by the method call.

An AccessException is thrown by certain methods of the java.rmi.Naming class (specifically bind, rebind, and unbind) and methods of the java.rmi.activation.ActivationSystem interface to indicate that the caller does not have permission to perform the action requested by the method call. If the method was invoked from a non-local host, then an AccessException is thrown.
An ActionListener object is registered via addActionListener.
An ActivationGroup is

An ActivationGroup is responsible for creating new instances of "activatable" objects in its group, informing its ActivationMonitor when either: its object's become active or inactive, or the group as a whole becomes inactive.
An ActivationInstantiator is responsible for creating instances of "activatable" objects.

An ActivationInstantiator is responsible for creating instances of "activatable" objects. A concrete subclass of ActivationGroup implements the newInstance method to handle creating objects within the group.
An ActivationMonitor is specific to an ActivationGroup and is obtained when a group is reported active via a call to ActivationSystem.activeGroup (this is done internally).

An ActivationMonitor is specific to an ActivationGroup and is obtained when a group is reported active via a call to ActivationSystem.activeGroup (this is done internally). An activation group is responsible for informing its ActivationMonitor when either: its objects become active or inactive, or the group as a whole becomes inactive.
An AdjustmentListener object is registered via addAdjustmentListener.

An AlgorithmParameters object for managing the parameters for a particular algorithm can be obtained by calling one of the getInstance factory methods (static methods that return instances of a given class).
trans-unit.target: Se puede obtener un objeto AlgorithmParameters para administrar los parámetros de un algoritmo particular llamando a uno de los métodos de fábrica getInstance (métodos estáticos que devuelven instancias de una clase determinada).

trans-unit.source: An AlreadyBoundException is thrown if an attempt is made to bind an object in the registry to a name that already has an associated binding.
An AlreadyBoundException is thrown if an attempt is made to bind an object to a name that already has an associated binding in the registry.

An Area may take more path segments to describe the same geometry even when the original outline is simple and obvious. The analysis that the Area class must perform on the path may not reflect the same concepts of "simple and obvious" as a human being perceives.
An Area object stores and manipulates a resolution-independent description of an enclosed area of 2-dimensional space.

An Area object stores and manipulates a resolution-independent description of an enclosed area of 2-dimensional space. Area objects can be transformed and can perform various Constructive Area Geometry (CAG) operations when combined with other Area objects. The CAG operations include area addition, subtraction, intersection, and exclusive or. See the linked method documentation for examples of the various operations.
An ArithmeticException exception is thrown if
trans-unit.target: Se lanza una excepción ArithmeticException si

trans-unit.source: An ArrayOutOfBoundsException may be thrown if the coordinates are not in bounds. However, explicit bounds checking is not guaranteed.
An ArrayOutOfBoundsException may be thrown if the region is not in bounds. However, explicit bounds checking is not guaranteed.

An ArrayType is assignable from another ArrayType if they have the same dimension; and both are primitive arrays or neither is; and the element type of the first is assignable from the element type of the second.

An ArrayType is assignable from another ArrayType if they have the same dimension; and both are primitive arrays or neither is; and the element type of the first is assignable from the element type of the second.
trans-unit.target: Un ArrayType se puede asignar desde otro ArrayType si tienen la misma dimensión ; y ambos son arreglos primitivos o ninguno lo es; y el tipo de elemento del primero es asignable a partir del tipo de elemento del segundo.

trans-unit.source: An Association is returned from an SctpChannel or an SctpMultiChannel, as well as being given as a parameter to NotificationHandler methods.

An AsynchronousFileChannel is associated with a thread pool to which tasks are submitted to handle I/O events and dispatch to completion handlers that consume the results of I/O operations on the channel. The completion handler for an I/O operation initiated on a channel is guaranteed to be invoked by one of the threads in the thread pool (This ensures that the completion handler is run by a thread with the expected identity). Where an I/O operation completes immediately, and the initiating thread is itself a thread in the thread pool, then the completion handler may be invoked directly by the initiating thread. When an AsynchronousFileChannel is created without specifying a thread pool then the channel is associated with a system-dependent default thread pool that may be shared with other channels. The default thread pool is configured by the system properties defined by the AsynchronousChannelGroup class.
trans-unit.target: Un AsynchronousFileChannel está asociado con un grupo de subprocesos al que se envían tareas para manejar eventos de E / S y enviar a controladores de finalización que consumen los resultados de las operaciones de E / S en el canal. Se garantiza que el controlador de finalización para una operación de E / S iniciada en un canal será invocado por uno de los subprocesos del grupo de subprocesos (esto asegura que el controlador de finalización lo ejecute un subproceso con la identidad esperada ). Cuando una operación de E / S se completa inmediatamente y el subproceso iniciador es en sí mismo un subproceso en el grupo de subprocesos, el controlador de finalización puede ser invocado directamente por el subproceso iniciador. Cuando un AsynchronousFileChannel se crea sin especificar un grupo de subprocesos, entonces el canal se asocia con un grupo de subprocesos predeterminado dependiente del sistema que se puede compartir con otros canales. El grupo de subprocesos predeterminado está configurado por las propiedades del sistema definidas por la clase AsynchronousChannelGroup .

trans-unit.source: An AtomicMarkableReference maintains an object reference along with a mark bit, that can be updated atomically.
trans-unit.target: Una AtomicMarkableReference mantiene una referencia de objeto junto con un bit de marca, que se puede actualizar atómicamente.

trans-unit.source: An AtomicStampedReference maintains an object reference along with an integer "stamp", that can be updated atomically.
trans-unit.target: Una AtomicStampedReference mantiene una referencia de objeto junto con un "sello" entero, que se puede actualizar atómicamente.

trans-unit.source: An AttachPermission object contains a name (also referred to as a "target name") but no actions list; you either have the named permission or you don't. The following table provides a summary description of what the permission allows, and discusses the risks of granting code the permission.
An AttributeValueExp may be used anywhere a ValueExp is required.
trans-unit.target: Un AttributeValueExp se puede utilizar en cualquier lugar ValueExp se requiera un ValueExp .

trans-unit.source: An AttributeValueExp with a null attribute.
trans-unit.target: Un AttributeValueExp con un atributo nulo.

trans-unit.source: An AttributedCharacterIterator allows iteration through both text and related attribute information.
trans-unit.target: Un AttributedCharacterIterator permite la iteración a través del texto y la información de atributos relacionados.

trans-unit.source: An Attributes, SearchControls, or array object passed as a parameter to any method will not be modified by the service provider. The service provider may keep a reference to it for the duration of the operation, including any enumeration of the method's results and the processing of any referrals generated. The caller should not modify the object during this time. An Attributes object returned by any method is owned by the caller. The caller may subsequently modify it; the service provider will not.
trans-unit.target: El proveedor de servicios no modificará un objeto Attributes , SearchControls o una matriz que se pase como parámetro a cualquier método. El proveedor de servicios puede mantener una referencia a él durante la duración de la operación, incluida cualquier enumeración de los resultados del método y el procesamiento de las referencias generadas. La persona que llama no debe modificar el objeto durante este tiempo. Un objeto Attributes devuelto por cualquier método es propiedad del llamador. La persona que llama puede modificarlo posteriormente; el proveedor de servicios no lo hará.

trans-unit.source: An AudioFileFormat object can include a set of properties. A property is a pair of key and value: the key is of type String, the associated property value is an arbitrary object. Properties specify additional informational meta data (like a author, copyright, or file duration). Properties are optional information, and file reader and file writer implementations are not required to provide or recognize properties.
trans-unit.target: Un objeto AudioFileFormat puede incluir un conjunto de propiedades. Una propiedad es un par de clave y valor: la clave es de tipo String , el valor de propiedad asociado es un objeto arbitrario. Las propiedades especifican metadatos informativos adicionales (como un autor, derechos de autor o duración del archivo). Las propiedades son información opcional y las implementaciones de lectores y grabadores de archivos no son necesarias para proporcionar o reconocer propiedades.

trans-unit.source: An AudioFormat object can include a set of properties. A property is a pair of key and value: the key is of type String, the associated property value is an arbitrary object. Properties specify additional format specifications, like the bit rate for compressed formats. Properties are mainly used as a means to transport additional information of the audio format to and from the service providers. Therefore, properties are ignored in the matches(AudioFormat) method. However, methods which rely on the installed service providers, like (AudioFormat, AudioFormat) isConversionSupported may consider properties, depending on the respective service provider implementation.

An AudioFormat object can include a set of properties. A property is a pair of key and value: the key is of type String, the associated property value is an arbitrary object. Properties specify additional format specifications, like the bit rate for compressed formats. Properties are mainly used as a means to transport additional information of the audio format to and from the service providers. Therefore, properties are ignored in the matches(AudioFormat) method. However, methods which rely on the installed service providers, like (AudioFormat, AudioFormat) isConversionSupported may consider properties, depending on the respective service provider implementation.
trans-unit.target: Un objeto AudioFormat puede incluir un conjunto de propiedades. Una propiedad es un par de clave y valor: la clave es de tipo String , el valor de propiedad asociado es un objeto arbitrario. Las propiedades especifican especificaciones de formato adicionales, como la velocidad de bits para formatos comprimidos. Las propiedades se utilizan principalmente como un medio para transportar información adicional del formato de audio hacia y desde los proveedores de servicios. Por lo tanto, las propiedades se ignoran en el método de matches(AudioFormat) . Sin embargo, los métodos que dependen de los proveedores de servicios instalados, como (AudioFormat, AudioFormat) isConversionSupported pueden considerar propiedades, dependiendo de la implementación del proveedor de servicios respectivo.

trans-unit.source: An Encoder is a class which can be used to create files or streams that encode the state of a collection of JavaBeans in terms of their public APIs.
trans-unit.target: Un Encoder es una clase que se puede utilizar para crear archivos o flujos que codifican el estado de una colección de JavaBeans en términos de sus API públicas.

trans-unit.source: An Encoder is a class which can be used to create files or streams that encode the state of a collection of JavaBeans in terms of their public APIs. The Encoder, in conjunction with its persistence delegates, is responsible for breaking the object graph down into a series of Statements and Expressions which can be used to create it. A subclass typically provides a syntax for these expressions using some human readable form - like Java source code or XML.

An Encoder is a class which can be used to create files or streams that encode the state of a collection of JavaBeans in terms of their public APIs. The Encoder, in conjunction with its persistence delegates, is responsible for breaking the object graph down into a series of Statementss and Expressions which can be used to create it. A subclass typically provides a syntax for these expressions using some human readable form - like Java source code or XML.
trans-unit.target: Un Encoder es una clase que se puede utilizar para crear archivos o flujos que codifican el estado de una colección de JavaBeans en términos de sus API públicas. El Encoder , junto con sus delegados de persistencia, es responsable de dividir el gráfico del objeto en una serie de Statements y Expression que se pueden usar para crearlo. Una subclase generalmente proporciona una sintaxis para estas expresiones utilizando alguna forma legible por humanos, como el código fuente de Java o XML.

trans-unit.source: An Entity node does not have any parent.
An Entry object is passed to instances of RowFilter, allowing the filter to get the value of the entry's data, and thus to determine whether the entry should be shown.

An Entry object is passed to instances of RowFilter, allowing the filter to get the value of the entry's data, and thus to determine whether the entry should be shown. An Entry object contains information about the model as well as methods for getting the underlying values from the model.
An EnumControl provides control over a set of discrete possible values, each represented by an object.

An EnumControl provides control over a set of discrete possible values, each represented by an object. In a graphical user interface, such a control might be represented by a set of buttons, each of which chooses one value or setting. For example, a reverb control might provide several preset reverberation settings, instead of providing continuously adjustable parameters of the sort that would be represented by FloatControl objects.
An Enumeration of URLs. If the loader is closed, the Enumeration contains no elements.
An Error is a subclass of Throwable that indicates serious problems that a reasonable application should not try to catch.
trans-unit.target: Un Error es una subclase de Throwable que indica problemas graves que una aplicación razonable no debería intentar detectar.

trans-unit.source: An Error is a subclass of Throwable that indicates serious problems that a reasonable application should not try to catch. Most such errors are abnormal conditions. The ThreadDeath error, though a "normal" condition, is also a subclass of Error because most applications should not try to catch it.
trans-unit.target: Un Error es una subclase de Throwable que indica problemas graves que una aplicación razonable no debería intentar detectar. La mayoría de estos errores son condiciones anormales. El error ThreadDeath , aunque es una condición "normal", también es una subclase de Error porque la mayoría de las aplicaciones no deberían intentar detectarlo.

trans-unit.source: An Event object generated when an event occurs to a RowSet object.
An Event object generated when an event occurs to a RowSet object. A RowSetEvent object is generated when a single row in a rowset is changed, the whole rowset is changed, or the rowset cursor moves.
An Event object that provides information about the source of a connection-related event.

An Event object that provides information about the source of a connection-related event. ConnectionEvent objects are generated when an application closes a pooled connection and when an error occurs. The ConnectionEvent object contains two kinds of information:
An EventSettings object for a recording can be obtained by invoking the Recording.enable(String) method which is configured using method chaining.

An ExecutorService can be shut down, which will cause it to reject new tasks. Two different methods are provided for shutting down an ExecutorService. The shutdown() method will allow previously submitted tasks to execute before terminating, while the shutdownNow() method prevents waiting tasks from starting and attempts to stop currently executing tasks. Upon termination, an executor has no tasks actively executing, no tasks awaiting execution, and no new tasks can be submitted. An unused ExecutorService should be shut down to allow reclamation of its resources.

An ExecutorService can be shut down, which will cause it to reject new tasks. Two different methods are provided for shutting down an ExecutorService. The shutdown() method will allow previously submitted tasks to execute before terminating, while the shutdownNow() method prevents waiting tasks from starting and attempts to stop currently executing tasks. Upon termination, an executor has no tasks actively executing, no tasks awaiting execution, and no new tasks can be submitted. An unused ExecutorService should be shut down to allow reclamation of its resources.
trans-unit.target: Un ExecutorService se puede cerrar, lo que hará que rechace nuevas tareas. Se proporcionan dos métodos diferentes para cerrar un ExecutorService . El método shutdown() permitirá que las tareas enviadas previamente se ejecuten antes de finalizar, mientras que el método shutdownNow() evita que se inicien las tareas en espera e intenta detener las tareas que se están ejecutando actualmente. Tras la terminación, un ejecutor no tiene tareas en ejecución activa, ninguna tarea en espera de ejecución y no se pueden enviar nuevas tareas. Un ExecutorService no utilizado debe cerrarse para permitir la recuperación de sus recursos.

trans-unit.source: An ExportException is a RemoteException thrown if an attempt to export a remote object fails.

An ExportException is a RemoteException thrown if an attempt to export a remote object fails. A remote object is exported via the constructors and exportObject methods of java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject and java.rmi.activation.Activatable.
An Expression object represents a primitive expression in which a single method is applied to a target and a set of arguments to return a result - as in "a.getFoo()".
trans-unit.target: Un objeto Expression representa una expresión primitiva en la que se aplica un único método a un objetivo y un conjunto de argumentos para devolver un resultado, como en "a.getFoo()" .

trans-unit.source: An HTMLCollection is a list of nodes.

An HTMLCollection is a list of nodes. An individual node may be accessed by either ordinal index or the node'sname or id attributes. Note: Collections in the HTML DOM are assumed to be live meaning that they are automatically updated when the underlying document is changed.
An HTMLDocument is the root of the HTML hierarchy and holds the entire content.

An HTMLDocument is the root of the HTML hierarchy and holds the entire content. Besides providing access to the hierarchy, it also provides some convenience methods for accessing certain sets of information from the document.
An HierarchyBoundsListener object is registered via addHierarchyBoundsListener.
An HierarchyListener object is registered via addHierarchyListener.

An HttpClient can be used to send requests and retrieve their responses. An HttpClient is created through a builder. The builder can be used to configure per-client state, like: the preferred protocol version ( HTTP/1.1 or HTTP/2 ), whether to follow redirects, a proxy, an authenticator, etc. Once built, an HttpClient is immutable, and can be used to send multiple requests.
An HttpClient provides configuration information, and resource sharing, for all requests sent through it.

An HttpHeaders is not typically created directly, but rather returned from an HttpRequest or an HttpResponse. Specific HTTP headers can be set for a request through one of the request builder's headers methods.

An HttpRequest instance is built through an HttpRequestbuilder. An HttpRequest builder is obtained from one of the newBuilder methods. A request's URI, headers, and body can be set. Request bodies are provided through a BodyPublisher supplied to one of the POST, PUT or method methods. Once all required parameters have been set in the builder, build will return the HttpRequest. Builders can be copied and modified many times in order to build multiple related requests that differ in some parameters.

An HttpResponse is not created directly, but rather returned as a result of sending an HttpRequest. An HttpResponse is made available when the response status code and headers have been received, and typically after the response body has also been completely received. Whether or not the HttpResponse is made available before the response body has been completely received depends on the BodyHandler provided when sending the HttpRequest.

An ICC_ColorSpace object can be constructed from an appropriate ICC_Profile. Typically, an ICC_ColorSpace would be associated with an ICC Profile which is either an input, display, or output profile (see the ICC specification). There are also device link, abstract, color space conversion, and named color profiles. These are less useful for tagging a color or image, but are useful for other purposes (in particular device link profiles can provide improved performance for converting from one device's color space to another's).
An IIOInvalidTreeException is thrown when an attempt by an IIOMetadata object to parse a tree of IIOMetadataNodes fails.
trans-unit.target: Se IIOInvalidTreeException una excepción IIOInvalidTreeException cuando un objeto IIOMetadata intenta analizar un árbol de IIOMetadataNode s falla.

trans-unit.source: An IIOInvalidTreeException is thrown when an attempt by an IIOMetadata object to parse a tree of IIOMetadataNodes fails. The node that led to the parsing error may be stored. As with any parsing error, the actual error may occur at a different point that that where it is detected. The node returned by getOffendingNode should merely be considered as a clue to the actual nature of the problem.
trans-unit.target: Se IIOInvalidTreeException una excepción IIOInvalidTreeException cuando falla un intento de un objeto IIOMetadata de analizar un árbol de IIOMetadataNode s. El nodo que provocó el error de análisis puede almacenarse. Al igual que con cualquier error de análisis, el error real puede ocurrir en un punto diferente al que se detectó. El nodo devuelto por getOffendingNode simplemente debe considerarse como una pista de la naturaleza real del problema.

trans-unit.source: An IIOMetadata object containing metadata associated with the image.
trans-unit.target: Un objeto IIOMetadata que contiene metadatos asociados con la imagen.

trans-unit.source: An IIOMetadataController that is suggested for use as the controller for this IIOMetadata object.

An IIOMetadataController that is suggested for use as the controller for this IIOMetadata object. It may be retrieved via getDefaultController. To install the default controller, call setController(getDefaultController()). This instance variable should be set by subclasses that choose to provide their own default controller, usually a GUI, for setting parameters.
trans-unit.target: Un IIOMetadataController que se sugiere para usar como controlador para este objeto IIOMetadata . Puede recuperarse mediante getDefaultController . Para instalar el controlador predeterminado, llame a setController(getDefaultController()) . Esta variable de instancia debe ser configurada por subclases que elijan proporcionar su propio controlador predeterminado, generalmente una GUI, para configurar los parámetros.

trans-unit.source: An IOException raised in WebSocket will result in an invocation of onError with that exception (if the input is not closed). Unless otherwise stated if the listener's method throws an exception or a CompletionStage returned from a method completes exceptionally, the WebSocket will invoke onError with this exception.
An IOException will be thrown if the previous marked position lies in the discarded portion of the stream.
trans-unit.target: Se lanzará una IOException si la posición marcada anteriormente se encuentra en la parte descartada de la secuencia.

trans-unit.source: An IllegalArgumentException is thrown if any of the argument keys are not recognized and are not namespace qualified.
An IllegalArgumentException is thrown if the precision section of the string is out of range (< 0) or the string is not in the format created by the toString() method.
An IllegalArgumentException is thrown if the precision section of the string is out of range (< 0) or the string is not in the format created by the toString() method.
trans-unit.target: Se IllegalArgumentException una IllegalArgumentException si la sección de precisión de la cadena está fuera de rango ( < 0 ) o si la cadena no está en el formato creado por el método toString() .

trans-unit.source: An IllegalArgumentException is thrown if the source is the same as the destination.
An IllegalArgumentException may be thrown if the source and/or destination image is incompatible with the types of images $ allowed by the class implementing this filter.
An IllegalStateException is thrown if nextSibling is not null and node is not a parent of nextSibling. An IllegalStateException is thrown if node is null and nextSibling is not null.
An ImageFilter subclass might override this method or not, depending on if and how it can send data in TDLR order. Three possibilities exist:

An ImageReadParam object is used to specify how an image, or a set of images, will be converted on input from a stream in the context of the Java Image I/O framework. A plug-in for a specific image format will return instances of ImageReadParam from the getDefaultReadParam method of its ImageReader implementation.
trans-unit.target: Un objeto ImageReadParam se utiliza para especificar cómo se convertirá una imagen, o un conjunto de imágenes, en la entrada de una secuencia en el contexto del marco de trabajo de E / S de imágenes de Java. Un complemento para un formato de imagen específico devolverá instancias de ImageReadParam del método getDefaultReadParam de su implementación ImageReader .

trans-unit.source: An ImageTranscoder may be used to convert the IIOMetadata objects supplied by the ImageReader (representing per-stream and per-image metadata) into corresponding objects suitable for encoding by a particular ImageWriter. In the case where the methods of this interface are being called directly on an ImageWriter, the output will be suitable for that writer.
trans-unit.target: Se puede utilizar un ImageTranscoder para convertir los objetos IIOMetadata proporcionados por ImageReader (que representan metadatos por flujo y por imagen) en objetos correspondientes adecuados para la codificación por un ImageWriter en particular . En el caso de que los métodos de esta interfaz se llamen directamente en un ImageWriter , la salida será adecuada para ese escritor.

trans-unit.source: An ImageTypeSpecifier to be used to generate a destination image when reading, or to set the output color type when writing.
An ImageTypeSpecifier to be used to generate a destination image when reading, or to set the output color type when writing. If non has been set the value will be null. By default, the value is null.
trans-unit.target: Un ImageTypeSpecifier que se utilizará para generar una imagen de destino al leer, o para establecer el tipo de color de salida al escribir. Si no se ha establecido, el valor será null . De forma predeterminada, el valor es null .

trans-unit.source: An ImageWriteParam may optionally be supplied for cases where it may affect thumbnail handling.
trans-unit.target: Opcionalmente, se puede suministrar un ImageWriteParam para los casos en los que pueda afectar el manejo de las miniaturas.

trans-unit.source: An ImageWriteParam may optionally be supplied to control the writing process. If param is null, a default write param will be used.
trans-unit.target: Opcionalmente, se puede suministrar un ImageWriteParam para controlar el proceso de escritura. Si param es null , se utilizará un parámetro de escritura predeterminado.

trans-unit.source: An IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown if pos is smaller than the flushed position (as returned by getflushedPosition).
trans-unit.target: Se IndexOutOfBoundsException una IndexOutOfBoundsException si pos es más pequeño que la posición getflushedPosition (como lo devuelve getflushedPosition ).

trans-unit.source: An InetAddress representing the address of the network interface used for multicast packets, or if no interface has been set, an InetAddress representing any local address.
An InetAddress representing the address of the network interface used for multicast packets.
trans-unit.target: Una InetAddress que representa la dirección de la interfaz de red utilizada para paquetes de multidifusión.

trans-unit.source: An InitMaxStreams instance
An InputMethodListener object is registered via addInputMethodListener.
An Insets object is a representation of the borders of a container.
An Insets object is a representation of the borders of a container. It specifies the space that a container must leave at each of its edges. The space can be a border, a blank space, or a title.
An InvalidMidiDataException indicates that inappropriate MIDI data was encountered.
trans-unit.target: Una InvalidMidiDataException indica que se encontraron datos MIDI inapropiados.

trans-unit.source: An InvalidMidiDataException indicates that inappropriate MIDI data was encountered. This often means that the data is invalid in and of itself, from the perspective of the MIDI specification. An example would be an undefined status byte. However, the exception might simply mean that the data was invalid in the context it was used, or that the object to which the data was given was unable to parse or use it. For example, a file reader might not be able to parse a Type 2 MIDI file, even though that format is defined in the MIDI specification.
trans-unit.target: Una InvalidMidiDataException indica que se encontraron datos MIDI inapropiados. Esto a menudo significa que los datos no son válidos en sí mismos, desde la perspectiva de la especificación MIDI. Un ejemplo sería un byte de estado indefinido. Sin embargo, la excepción podría significar simplemente que los datos no eran válidos en el contexto en el que se usaron, o que el objeto al que se proporcionaron los datos no pudo analizarlos o usarlos. Por ejemplo, es posible que un lector de archivos no pueda analizar un archivo MIDI de tipo 2, aunque ese formato esté definido en la especificación MIDI.

trans-unit.source: An ItemListener object is registered via addItemListener.

An Iterator that yields provider objects for the given service, in some arbitrary order. The iterator will throw an Error if a provider-configuration file violates the specified format or if a provider class cannot be found and instantiated.
trans-unit.target: Un Iterator que produce objetos de proveedor para el servicio dado, en algún orden arbitrario. El iterador arrojará un Error si un archivo de configuración de proveedor viola el formato especificado o si no se puede encontrar y crear una instancia de una clase de proveedor.

trans-unit.source: An OBJECT_CHANGED event type is fired when (the contents of) an object has changed. This might mean that its attributes have been modified, added, or removed, and/or that the object itself has been replaced. How the object has changed can be determined by examining the NamingEvent's old and new bindings.
trans-unit.target: Un tipo de evento OBJECT_CHANGED se activa cuando (el contenido de) un objeto ha cambiado. Esto podría significar que sus atributos se han modificado, agregado o eliminado, y / o que el objeto en sí ha sido reemplazado. La forma en que ha cambiado el objeto se puede determinar examinando los enlaces nuevos y antiguos de NamingEvent .

trans-unit.source: An ObjID created via this constructor will not clash with any ObjIDs generated via the no-arg constructor.

An ObjID instance contains an object number (of type long) and an address space identifier (of type UID). In a unique ObjID, the address space identifier is unique with respect to a given host over time. In a well-known ObjID, the address space identifier is equivalent to one returned by invoking the UID(short) constructor with the value zero.
An ObjID is used to identify a remote object exported to an RMI runtime.

An ObjID is used to identify a remote object exported to an RMI runtime. When a remote object is exported, it is assigned an object identifier either implicitly or explicitly, depending on the API used to export.
An Object array parsed from the string.
trans-unit.target: Una matriz de Object analizada a partir de la cadena.

trans-unit.target: Una matriz de Object analizada a partir de la cadena. En caso de error, devuelve nulo.

trans-unit.target: Se puede suministrar un Object al complemento en el momento de la construcción. La naturaleza del objeto es completamente específica del complemento.

An ObjectInstance, containing the ObjectName and the Java class name of the newly instantiated MBean. If the contained ObjectName is n, the contained Java class name is getMBeanInfo(n).getClassName().

An ObjectInstance, containing the ObjectName and the Java class name of the newly instantiated MBean. If the contained ObjectName is n, the contained Java class name is getMBeanInfo(n).getClassName().

An ObjectInstance, containing the ObjectName and the Java class name of the newly instantiated MBean. If the contained ObjectName is n, the contained Java class name is getMBeanInfo(n).getClassName().

trans-unit.target: Una ObjectInstance , que contiene el ObjectName y el nombre de la clase Java del MBean recién registrado. Si el ObjectName contenido es n , el nombre de la clase Java contenida es getMBeanInfo(n).getClassName() .

trans-unit.source: An ObjectInstance, containing the ObjectName and the Java class name of the newly registered MBean. If the contained ObjectName is n, the contained Java class name is getMBeanInfo(n).getClassName().

An Operation contains a description of a Java method. Operation objects were used in JDK1.1 version stubs and skeletons. The Operation class is not needed for 1.2 style stubs (stubs generated with rmic -v1.2); hence, this class is deprecated.

An Operation contains a description of a Java method. Operation objects were used in JDK1.1 version stubs and skeletons. The Operation class is not needed for 1.2 style stubs; hence, this class is deprecated.

An RMIClientSocketFactory instance associated with a remote object will be downloaded to clients when the remote object's reference is transmitted in an RMI call. This RMIClientSocketFactory will be used to create connections to the remote object for remote method calls.
An RMIClientSocketFactory instance can also be associated with a remote object registry so that clients can use custom socket communication with a remote object registry.
An RMIClientSocketFactory instance is used by the RMI runtime in order to obtain client sockets for RMI calls.

An RMIClientSocketFactory instance is used by the RMI runtime in order to obtain client sockets for RMI calls. A remote object can be associated with an RMIClientSocketFactory when it is created/exported via the constructors or exportObject methods of java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject and java.rmi.activation.Activatable .
An RMIFailureHandler can be registered via the RMISocketFactory.setFailureHandler call.

An RMIFailureHandler can be registered via the RMISocketFactory.setFailureHandler call. The failure method of the handler is invoked when the RMI runtime is unable to create a ServerSocket to listen for incoming calls. The failure method returns a boolean indicating whether the runtime should attempt to re-create the ServerSocket.
An RMISecurityException signals that a security exception has occurred during the execution of one of java.rmi.RMISecurityManager's methods.
An RMIServerSocketFactory instance associated with a remote object is used to obtain the ServerSocket used to accept incoming calls from clients.
An RMIServerSocketFactory instance can also be associated with a remote object registry so that clients can use custom socket communication with a remote object registry.
An RMIServerSocketFactory instance is used by the RMI runtime in order to obtain server sockets for RMI calls.

An RMIServerSocketFactory instance is used by the RMI runtime in order to obtain server sockets for RMI calls. A remote object can be associated with an RMIServerSocketFactory when it is created/exported via the constructors or exportObject methods of java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject and java.rmi.activation.Activatable .
An RMISocketFactory instance is used by the RMI runtime in order to obtain client and server sockets for RMI calls.

An RMISocketFactory instance is used by the RMI runtime in order to obtain client and server sockets for RMI calls. An application may use the setSocketFactory method to request that the RMI runtime use its socket factory instance instead of the default implementation.

An SCTPServerChannel is created by invoking the open method of this class. A newly-created SCTP server channel is open but not yet bound. An attempt to invoke the accept method of an unbound channel will cause the NotYetBoundException to be thrown. An SCTP server channel can be bound by invoking one of the bind methods defined by this class.

An SSLEngine is created by calling SSLContext.createSSLEngine() from an initialized SSLContext. Any configuration parameters should be set before making the first call to wrap(), unwrap(), or beginHandshake(). These methods all trigger the initial handshake.

An SSLEngine is created by calling SSLContext.createSSLEngine() from an initialized SSLContext. Any configuration parameters should be set before making the first call to wrap(), unwrap(), or beginHandshake(). These methods all trigger the initial handshake.
trans-unit.target: Un SSLEngine se crea llamando a SSLContext.createSSLEngine() desde un SSLContext inicializado . Cualquier parámetro de configuración debe establecerse antes de realizar la primera llamada a wrap() , unwrap() o beginHandshake() . Todos estos métodos activan el apretón de manos inicial.

trans-unit.source: An SSLEngine using this session may generate SSL/TLS/DTLS packets of any size up to and including the value returned by this method. All SSLEngine network buffers should be sized at least this large to avoid insufficient space problems when performing wrap and unwrap calls.
An SSLEngineResult enum describing the current handshaking state of this SSLEngine.
trans-unit.target: Una enumeración SSLEngineResult que describe el estado actual del protocolo de enlace de este SSLEngine .

trans-unit.source: An SSLEngineResult enum describing the overall result of the SSLEngine operation.
trans-unit.target: Una enumeración SSLEngineResult que describe el resultado general de la operación SSLEngine .

trans-unit.source: An SSLEngineResult enum describing the overall result of the SSLEngine operation. The Status value does not reflect the state of a SSLEngine handshake currently in progress. The SSLEngineResult's HandshakeStatus should be consulted for that information.
trans-unit.target: Una enumeración SSLEngineResult que describe el resultado general de la operación SSLEngine . El valor de Status no refleja el estado de un SSLEngine enlace SSLEngine actualmente en curso. Se debe consultar SSLEngineResult's HandshakeStatus para obtener esa información.

trans-unit.source: An SSLServerSocket contains several pieces of state data which are inherited by the SSLSocket at socket creation. These include the enabled cipher suites and protocols, whether client authentication is necessary, and whether created sockets should begin handshaking in client or server mode. The state inherited by the created SSLSocket can be overridden by calling the appropriate methods.

An SSLServerSocket contains several pieces of state data which are inherited by the SSLSocket at socket creation. These include the enabled cipher suites and protocols, whether client authentication is necessary, and whether created sockets should begin handshaking in client or server mode. The state inherited by the created SSLSocket can be overriden by calling the appropriate methods.
An SctpMultiChannel can control more than one association, the association parameter must be given when setting or retrieving this option.
An ServerNotActiveException is an Exception thrown during a call to RemoteServer.getClientHost if the getClientHost method is called outside of servicing a remote method call.
An SslRMIClientSocketFactory instance is used by the RMI runtime in order to obtain client sockets for RMI calls via SSL.
An SslRMIServerSocketFactory instance is used by the RMI runtime in order to obtain server sockets for RMI calls via SSL.

An UndeclaredThrowableException instance contains the undeclared checked exception that was thrown by the invocation handler, and it can be retrieved with the getUndeclaredThrowable() method. UndeclaredThrowableException extends RuntimeException, so it is an unchecked exception that wraps a checked exception.
trans-unit.target: Una instancia de UndeclaredThrowableException contiene la excepción marcada no declarada que lanzó el controlador de invocación, y se puede recuperar con el método getUndeclaredThrowable() . UndeclaredThrowableException extiende RuntimeException , por lo que es una excepción sin marcar que envuelve una excepción marcada.

trans-unit.source: An UndoableEdit represents an edit.
An UndoableEdit represents an edit. The edit may be undone, or if already undone the edit may be redone.
An UndoableEditListener method.
An UndoableEditListener method. This invokes addEdit with e.getEdit().

An UnexpectedException is thrown if the client of a remote method call receives, as a result of the call, a checked exception that is not among the checked exception types declared in the throws clause of the method in the remote interface.

An UnknownGroupException is thrown by methods of classes and interfaces in the java.rmi.activation package when the ActivationGroupID parameter to the method is determined to be invalid, i.e., not known by the ActivationSystem.

An UnknownGroupException is thrown by methods of classes and interfaces in the java.rmi.activation package when the ActivationGroupID parameter to the method is determined to be invalid, i.e., not known by the ActivationSystem. An UnknownGroupException is also thrown if the ActivationGroupID in an ActivationDesc refers to a group that is not registered with the ActivationSystem
An UnknownHostException is thrown if a java.net.UnknownHostException occurs while creating a connection to the remote host for a remote method call.
An UnknownObjectException is thrown by methods of classes and interfaces in the java.rmi.activation package when the ActivationID parameter to the method is determined to be invalid.

An UnknownObjectException is thrown by methods of classes and interfaces in the java.rmi.activation package when the ActivationID parameter to the method is determined to be invalid. An ActivationID is invalid if it is not currently known by the ActivationSystem. An ActivationID is obtained by the ActivationSystem.registerObject method. An ActivationID is also obtained during the Activatable.register call.
An UnmarshalException can be thrown while unmarshalling the parameters or results of a remote method call if any of the following conditions occur:

An UnmarshalException can be thrown while unmarshalling the parameters or results of a remote method call if any of the following conditions occur: if an exception occurs while unmarshalling the call header if the protocol for the return value is invalid if a java.io.IOException occurs unmarshalling parameters (on the server side) or the return value (on the client side).
An UnsupportedAudioFileException is an exception indicating that an operation failed because a file did not contain valid data of a recognized file type and format.
trans-unit.target: Una UnsupportedAudioFileException es una excepción que indica que una operación falló porque un archivo no contenía datos válidos de un tipo y formato de archivo reconocidos.

An XMLSignatureException can contain a cause: another throwable that caused this XMLSignatureException to get thrown.
An XPathFactory instance can be used to create XPath objects.
An XPathFactory instance can be used to create XPath objects.

An XmlReader object is registered as the XML reader for a WebRowSet by being assigned to the rowset's xmlReader field. When the WebRowSet object's readXml method is invoked, it in turn invokes its XML reader's readXML method.
An int array containing information about a column of pixels.
An int array containing information about a row of pixels.
An int array in which elements may be updated atomically.
trans-unit.target: Una matriz int en la que los elementos se pueden actualizar atómicamente.

trans-unit.source: An int array in which elements may be updated atomically. See the VarHandle specification for descriptions of the properties of atomic accesses.
An int array in which elements may be updated atomically. See the java.util.concurrent.atomic package specification for description of the properties of atomic variables.
trans-unit.target: Una matriz int en la que los elementos se pueden actualizar atómicamente. Consulte la especificación del paquete java.util.concurrent.atomic para obtener una descripción de las propiedades de las variables atómicas.

trans-unit.source: An int representing a "copy" action.
An int representing a "copy" or "move" action.
An int representing a "copy" transfer action.
An int representing a "copy" transfer action. This value is used when data is copied to a clipboard or copied elsewhere in a drag and drop operation.
An int representing a "link" action.

An int representing a "link" action. The link verb is found in many, if not all native DnD platforms, and the actual interpretation of LINK semantics is both platform and application dependent. Broadly speaking, the semantic is "do not copy, or move the operand, but create a reference to it". Defining the meaning of "reference" is where ambiguity is introduced. The verb is provided for completeness, but its use is not recommended for DnD operations between logically distinct applications where misinterpretation of the operations semantics could lead to confusing results for the user.
An int representing a "link" transfer action.
An int representing a "link" transfer action. This value is used to specify that data should be linked in a drag and drop operation.
An int representing a "move" action.
An int representing a "move" transfer action.
An int representing a "move" transfer action. This value is used when data is moved to a clipboard (i.e. a cut) or moved elsewhere in a drag and drop operation.
An int representing a "reference" action (synonym for ACTION_LINK).
An int representing a source action capability of either "copy" or "move".
An int representing no action.
An int representing no transfer action.
An int representing the three digit HTTP Status-Code.
trans-unit.target: Un int que representa el código de estado HTTP de tres dígitos.

trans-unit.source: An int representing the type(s) of action(s) used in this Drag and Drop operation.
An int used by updateCurrentCursor() indicating that the Cursor has entered a DropTarget.
An int used by updateCurrentCursor() indicating that the Cursor is over a DropTarget.
An int used by updateCurrentCursor() indicating that the Cursor should change to the default (no drop) Cursor.
An int used by updateCurrentCursor() indicating that the user operation has changed.
An int value that may be updated atomically.
trans-unit.target: Un valor int que se puede actualizar atómicamente.

trans-unit.source: An int value that may be updated atomically. See the VarHandle specification for descriptions of the properties of atomic accesses. An AtomicInteger is used in applications such as atomically incremented counters, and cannot be used as a replacement for an Integer. However, this class does extend Number to allow uniform access by tools and utilities that deal with numerically-based classes.

An int value that may be updated atomically. See the java.util.concurrent.atomic package specification for description of the properties of atomic variables. An AtomicInteger is used in applications such as atomically incremented counters, and cannot be used as a replacement for an Integer. However, this class does extend Number to allow uniform access by tools and utilities that deal with numerically-based classes.
trans-unit.target: Un valor int que se puede actualizar atómicamente. Consulte la especificación del paquete java.util.concurrent.atomic para obtener una descripción de las propiedades de las variables atómicas. Un AtomicInteger se usa en aplicaciones como contadores incrementados atómicamente y no se puede usar como reemplazo de un Integer . Sin embargo, esta clase amplía Number para permitir el acceso uniforme de herramientas y utilidades que tratan con clases basadas en números.

trans-unit.source: An invokedynamic instruction is linked just before its first execution. A dynamically-computed constant is resolved just before the first time it is used (by pushing it on the stack or linking it as a bootstrap method parameter). The bootstrap method call implementing the linkage occurs within a thread that is attempting a first execution or first use.
An invokedynamic instruction is originally in an unlinked state. In this state, there is no target method for the instruction to invoke.

An MXBean is a variant of Standard MBean where complex types are mapped to a standard set of types defined in the javax.management.openmbean package. MXBeans are appropriate if you would otherwise need to reference application-specific classes in your MBean interface. They are described in detail in the specification for MXBean.
trans-unit.target: Un MXBean es una variante de Standard MBean donde los tipos complejos se asignan a un conjunto estándar de tipos definidos en el paquete javax.management.openmbean . Los MXBeans son apropiados si de otro modo necesitaría hacer referencia a clases específicas de la aplicación en su interfaz MBean. Se describen en detalle en la especificación de MXBean .

trans-unit.source: An Open MBean is a kind of Dynamic MBean where the types of attributes and of operation parameters and return values are built using a small set of predefined Java classes. Open MBeans facilitate operation with remote management programs that do not necessarily have access to application-specific types, including non-Java programs. Open MBeans are defined by the package javax.management.openmbean.
trans-unit.target: Un Open MBean es una especie de Dynamic MBean donde los tipos de atributos, parámetros de operación y valores de retorno se construyen utilizando un pequeño conjunto de clases Java predefinidas. Los MBeans abiertos facilitan la operación con programas de administración remota que no necesariamente tienen acceso a tipos específicos de aplicaciones, incluidos los programas que no son de Java. Los MBeans abiertos están definidos por el paquete javax.management.openmbean .

trans-unit.source: An offset value can be specified. When an observed value exceeds its threshold, the threshold is incremented by the offset, or by a multiple of the offset sufficient to make the threshold greater than the new observed value.
trans-unit.target: Se puede especificar un valor de compensación . Cuando un valor observado excede su umbral, el umbral se incrementa por el desplazamiento, o por un múltiplo del desplazamiento suficiente para hacer que el umbral sea mayor que el nuevo valor observado.

trans-unit.source: An unquoted value is a possibly empty string of characters which may not contain any of the characters comma, equals, colon, or quote.
trans-unit.target: Un valor sin comillas es una cadena de caracteres posiblemente vacía que no puede contener ninguno de los caracteres comas, iguales, dos puntos o comillas.

trans-unit.source: An ACL can be thought of as a data structure with multiple ACL entries. Each ACL entry, of interface type AclEntry, contains a set of permissions associated with a particular principal. (A principal represents an entity such as an individual user or a group). Additionally, each ACL entry is specified as being either positive or negative. If positive, the permissions are to be granted to the associated principal. If negative, the permissions are to be denied.
trans-unit.target: Un ACL puede ser pensado como una estructura de datos con mltiples entradas de ACL.Cada entrada de ACL,de tipo interfaz AclEntry,contiene un conjunto de permisos asociados a un principio particular.(Una entidad principal representa una entidad como un usuario individual o un grupo).Adems,cada entrada de ACL se especifica como positiva o negativa.Si es positiva,los permisos deben concederse a la entidad principal asociada.Si es negativa,los permisos se denegarn.

trans-unit.source: An ACL can be thought of as a data structure with multiple ACL entry objects. Each ACL entry object contains a set of permissions associated with a particular principal. (A principal represents an entity such as an individual user or a group). Additionally, each ACL entry is specified as being either positive or negative. If positive, the permissions are to be granted to the associated principal. If negative, the permissions are to be denied. Each principal can have at most one positive ACL entry and one negative entry; that is, multiple positive or negative ACL entries are not allowed for any principal. Note: ACL entries are by default positive. An entry becomes a negative entry only if the setNegativePermissions method is called on it.

An ACL can be thought of as a data structure with multiple ACL entry objects. Each ACL entry object contains a set of permissions associated with a particular principal. (A principal represents an entity such as an individual user or a group). Additionally, each ACL entry is specified as being either positive or negative. If positive, the permissions are to be granted to the associated principal. If negative, the permissions are to be denied. Each principal can have at most one positive ACL entry and one negative entry; that is, multiple positive or negative ACL entries are not allowed for any principal. Note: ACL entries are by default positive. An entry becomes a negative entry only if the setNegativePermissions method is called on it.
trans-unit.target: Una ACL se puede considerar como una estructura de datos con varios objetos de entrada de ACL. Cada objeto de entrada de ACL contiene un conjunto de permisos asociados con un principal en particular. (Un principal representa una entidad como un usuario individual o un grupo). Además, cada entrada de ACL se especifica como positiva o negativa. Si es positivo, los permisos se otorgarán al principal asociado. Si es negativo, se negarán los permisos. Cada principal puede tener como máximo una entrada ACL positiva y una entrada negativa; es decir, no se permiten múltiples entradas de ACL positivas o negativas para ningún principal. Nota: Las entradas de ACL son positivas por defecto. Una entrada se convierte en una entrada negativa solo si se setNegativePermissions método setNegativePermissions .

An ANSI-style JOIN providing a full JOIN.
An ANSI-style JOIN providing a full JOIN. Specifies that all rows from either table be returned regardless of matching records on the other table.
An ANSI-style JOIN providing a inner join between two tables.
An ANSI-style JOIN providing a inner join between two tables. Any unmatched rows in either table of the join should be discarded.
An ANSI-style JOIN providing a left outer join between two tables.
An ANSI-style JOIN providing a left outer join between two tables. In SQL, this is described where all records should be returned from the left side of the JOIN statement.
An ANSI-style JOIN providing a right outer join between two tables.

An ANSI-style JOIN providing a right outer join between two tables. In SQL, this is described where all records from the table on the right side of the JOIN statement even if the table on the left has no matching record.
An AWT component, but nothing else is known about it.

trans-unit.source: An AccessControlContext is used to make system resource access decisions based on the context it encapsulates.
trans-unit.target: El AccessControlContext se utiliza para tomar decisiones de acceso a los recursos del sistema basadas en el contexto que encapsula.

trans-unit.source: An Action implementation useful for key bindings that are shared across a number of different text components.

An Action implementation useful for key bindings that are shared across a number of different text components. Because the action is shared, it must have a way of getting it's target to act upon. This class provides support to try and find a text component to operate on. The preferred way of getting the component to act upon is through the ActionEvent that is received. If the Object returned by getSource can be narrowed to a text component, it will be used. If the action event is null or can't be narrowed, the last focused text component is tried. This is determined by being used in conjunction with a JTextController which arranges to share that information with a TextAction.

trans-unit.source: An AttributedString holds text and related attribute information.
trans-unit.target: Una AttributedString contiene texto e informacin de atributos relacionada.

trans-unit.source: An AttributedString holds text and related attribute information. It may be used as the actual data storage in some cases where a text reader wants to access attributed text through the AttributedCharacterIterator interface.

trans-unit.source: An EdEC point is specified by its y-coordinate value and a boolean that indicates whether the x-coordinate is odd. The y-coordinate is an element of the field of integers modulo some value p that is determined by the algorithm parameters. This field element is represented by a BigInteger, and implementations that consume objects of this class may reject integer values which are not in the range [0, p).

An EditorKit has the ability to be read and save documents. It is generally the most pleasing to users if there is no loss of data between the two operation. The policy of the HTMLEditorKit will be to store things not recognized or not necessarily visible so they can be subsequently written out. The model of the HTML document should therefore contain all information discovered while reading the document. This is constrained in some ways by the need to support editing (i.e. incorrect documents sometimes must be normalized). The guiding principle is that information shouldn't be lost, but some might be synthesized to produce a more correct model or it might be rearranged.
An Edwards-Curve private key is a bit string. This interface only supports bit string lengths that are a multiple of 8, and the key is represented using a byte array.
An Edwards-Curve public key is a point on the curve, which is represented using an EdECPoint.

An Element represents a specific region in a Document that begins with startOffset and ends just before endOffset. The start offset of a branch Element is usually the start offset of its first child. Similarly, the end offset of a branch Element is usually the end offset of its last child.
An Encoded Form
trans-unit.target: Una forma codificada

trans-unit.source: An Entry maintaining a key and a value. The value may be changed using the setValue method. This class facilitates the process of building custom map implementations. For example, it may be convenient to return arrays of SimpleEntry instances in method Map.entrySet().toArray.
trans-unit.target: Una entrada que mantiene una clave y un valor. El valor se puede cambiar utilizando el método setValue . Esta clase facilita el proceso de creación de implementaciones de mapas personalizados. Por ejemplo, puede ser conveniente devolver matrices de instancias de SimpleEntry en el método Map.entrySet().toArray .

trans-unit.target: Una entrada que mantiene una clave y un valor inmutable.

trans-unit.source: An Entry maintaining an immutable key and value. This class does not support method setValue. This class may be convenient in methods that return thread-safe snapshots of key-value mappings.
trans-unit.target: Una entrada que mantiene una clave y un valor inmutables. Esta clase no admite el método setValue . Esta clase puede ser conveniente en métodos que devuelven instantáneas seguras para subprocesos de asignaciones clave-valor.

trans-unit.source: An ErrorListener instance can be registered to a TransformerFactory or Transformer through the TransformerFactory.setErrorListener(ErrorListener) or Transformer.setErrorListener(ErrorListener) method to receive errors and warnings reported by the TransformerFactory or Transformer.
An EventSetDescriptor describes a group of events that a given Java bean fires.
trans-unit.target: Un EventSetDescriptor describe un grupo de eventos que un determinado frijol de Java dispara.

trans-unit.source: An HTML link.
An HTML reader to load an HTML document with an HTML element structure.

An HTML reader to load an HTML document with an HTML element structure. This is a set of callbacks from the parser, implemented to create a set of elements tagged with attributes. The parse builds up tokens (ElementSpec) that describe the element subtree desired, and burst it into the document under the protection of a write lock using the insert method on the document outer class.
An HTTP Client.

An HTTP header name may appear more than once in the HTTP protocol. As such, headers are represented as a name and a list of values. Each occurrence of a header value is added verbatim, to the appropriate header name list, without interpreting its value. In particular, HttpHeaders does not perform any splitting or joining of comma separated header value strings. The order of elements in a header value list is preserved when building a request. For responses, the order of elements in a header value list is the order in which they were received. The Map returned by the map method, however, does not provide any guarantee with regard to the ordering of its entries.
An HTTP header name may appear more than once in the HTTP protocol. Such,
An HTTP request.
An HTTP response.
An HttpCookie object represents an HTTP cookie, which carries state information between server and user agent.
trans-unit.target: Un objeto HttpCookie representa una cookie HTTP,que lleva informacin de estado entre el servidor y el agente de usuario.

trans-unit.source: An HttpCookie object represents an HTTP cookie, which carries state information between server and user agent. Cookie is widely adopted to create stateful sessions.
trans-unit.target: Un objeto HttpCookie representa una cookie HTTP,que lleva informacin de estado entre el servidor y el agente de usuario.La cookie es ampliamente adoptada para crear sesiones de estado.

trans-unit.source: An I/O error occurs, in which case an IOException other than EOFException is thrown.
trans-unit.target: Se produce un error de E / S, en cuyo caso se lanza una IOException distinta de EOFException .

trans-unit.source: An ICC_ColorSpace object can be constructed from an appropriate ICC_Profile. Typically, an ICC_ColorSpace would be associated with an ICC Profile which is either an input, display, or output profile (see the ICC specification). There are also device link, abstract, color space conversion, and named color profiles. These are less useful for tagging a color or image, but are useful for other purposes (in particular device link profiles can provide improved performance for converting from one device's color space to another's).

An IP address is either a 32-bit or 128-bit unsigned number used by IP, a lower-level protocol on which protocols like UDP and TCP are built. The IP address architecture is defined by RFC 790: Assigned Numbers, RFC 1918: Address Allocation for Private Internets, RFC 2365: Administratively Scoped IP Multicast, and RFC 2373: IP Version 6 Addressing Architecture. An instance of an InetAddress consists of an IP address and possibly its corresponding host name (depending on whether it is constructed with a host name or whether it has already done reverse host name resolution).
trans-unit.target: Una dirección IP es un número sin firmar de 32 bits o de 128 bits utilizado por IP, un protocolo de nivel inferior en el que se construyen protocolos como UDP y TCP. La arquitectura de la dirección IP está definida por RFC 790: Números asignados , RFC 1918: Asignación de direcciones para Internet privado , RFC 2365: Multidifusión IP de ámbito administrativo y RFC 2373: Arquitectura de direccionamiento IP versión 6 . Una instancia de InetAddress consta de una dirección IP y posiblemente su correspondiente nombre de host (dependiendo de si está construida con un nombre de host o si ya ha realizado la resolución inversa del nombre de host).

trans-unit.source: An IP address is either a 32-bit or 128-bit unsigned number used by IP, a lower-level protocol on which protocols like UDP and TCP are built. The IP address architecture is defined by RFC 790: Assigned Numbers, RFC 1918: Address Allocation for Private Internets, RFC 2365: Administratively Scoped IP Multicast, and RFC 2373: IP Version 6 Addressing Architecture. An instance of an InetAddress consists of an IP address and possibly its corresponding host name (depending on whether it is constructed with a host name or whether it has already done reverse host name resolution).

An IPv6 address enclosed in square brackets ('[' and ']') and consisting of hexadecimal digits, colon characters (':'), and possibly an embedded IPv4 address. The full syntax of IPv6 addresses is specified in RFC 2373: IPv6 Addressing Architecture.
trans-unit.target: Una dirección IPv6 entre corchetes ( '[' y ']' ) y que consta de dígitos hexadecimales, dos puntos ( ':' ) y posiblemente una dirección IPv4 incorporada. La sintaxis completa de las direcciones IPv6 se especifica en RFC 2373: Arquitectura de direccionamiento IPv6 .

trans-unit.source: An IPv6 address enclosed in square brackets ('[' and ']') and consisting of hexadecimal digits, colon characters (':'), and possibly an embedded IPv4 address. The full syntax of IPv6 addresses is specified in RFC 2373: IPv6 Addressing Architecture.
An Icon wrapper class which implements UIResource.

An Icon wrapper class which implements UIResource. UI classes which set icon properties should use this class to wrap any icons specified as defaults. This class delegates all method invocations to the Icon "delegate" object specified at construction.
An Identity also has a set of certificates (all certifying its own public key). The Principal names specified in these certificates need not be the same, only the key.
